data.title: What we know about Alec Baldwin, a prop gun and a death on the set of 'Rust' movie
data.meta_description: Authorities say Alec Baldwin discharged a prop gun while filming \
data.text:
Authorities say Alec Baldwin discharged a prop gun on the set of the upcoming movie "Rust" Thursday, resulting in the death of the cinematographer and injuring the director of the film.

Production of the movie "Rust," a western being filmed in Santa Fe, has been halted while authorities investigate the incident.

Filming was set to continue into early November.

Here's what we know about the fatal incident on the set of "Rust" involving Alec Baldwin.

Alec Baldwin shooting a prop gun on the set of 'Rust'

Alec Baldwin, 68, stars in the film "Rust" and also serves as a producer on the film.

According to the sheriff's office, deputies responded to a 911 call Thursday afternoon that someone had been shot on the set of "Rust."

A release from the sheriff's office states: "According to investigators it appears that the scene being filmed involved the use of a prop firearm when it was discharged. Detectives are investigating how and what type of projectile was discharged."

More: Alec Baldwin discharged prop gun in incident that killed cinematographer, injured director, authorities say

Haylna Hutchins was killed in prop gun incident on the set of 'Rust'

The cinematographer for "Rust" was killed in the incident, and the director was injured as a result of the prop gun incident involving Alec Baldwin.

The cinematographer, 42-year-old Halyna Hutchins, was pronounced dead by medical personnel after being flown to the University of New Mexico Hospital, according to the Santa Fe County Sheriff's Office.

Director Joel Souza, 42, has been released from hospital care, according to a report from Deadline.

It was previously reported that Souza was receiving emergency treatment for his injuries. He was transported by ambulance to Christus St. Vincent's hospital.

More: Feature films 'Rust,' 'Outlaw Land' shoot in Santa Fe, Albuquerque

Alec Baldwin statement expresses 'shock and sadness'

Alec Baldwin shared his thoughts on the fatal prop gun incident on Twitter Friday morning.

USA TODAY's earlier attempts to obtain comment from Alec Baldwin had been unsuccessful as of Friday morning.

According to a report from The Santa Fe New Mexican, Baldwin was seen in tears outside the sheriff's office Thursday.

A spokesperson for Baldwin reportedly told The Associated Press that there was an accident on the set of "Rust" involving the misfire of a prop gun with blanks.

More: Alec Baldwin says he's 'fully cooperating' after deadly prop gun incident: 'My heart is broken'

Hollywood reacts to Alec Baldwin prop gun incident

The International Cinematographers Guild confirmed Thursday that the woman fatally shot in the incident on the set of "Rust" was Halyna Hutchins.

Halyna Hutchins served as director of cinematography for the action film "Archenemy" in 2020.

The Ukrainian-born Hutchins graduated from the American Film Institute in 2015 and was named a "rising star" by American Cinematographer four years later.

The death of Halyna Hutchins drew reactions from many in Hollywood Thursday.

Director Adam Egypt Mortimer worked on "Archenemy" with Halyna Hutchins.

Elijah Wood shared thoughts on Halyna Hutchins on Twitter.

Director James Gunn also shared his condolences on the death of Halyna Hutchins.

Charges have not been filed in the Alec Baldwin prop gun incident

As of Friday morning, authorities haven't filed charges in the incident. Witnesses are being interviewed, and the incident remains under active investigation.

Location of 'Rust' production used for previous Hollywood movies

Bonanza Creek Ranch, located near Santa Fe, is where filming for "Rust" was taking place when Alec Baldwin discharged a prop gun that killed one person and injured another. Bonanza Creek Ramnch has been a production location for many Hollywood movies.

The first film at Bonanza Creek Ranch was made in 1955, according to their website.

Also according to the Bonanza Creek Ranch website, movies recently filmed at the location include:

Hostiles

3:10 to Yuma

Only the Brave

The Ballad of Buster Scruggs

Longmire

Wild Hogs

Manhattan

Appaloosa

Charles Trepany and Elise Brisco of USA Today contributed to this report.
